paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the TTR gene and its variants, specifically focusing on the L55P mutation and its effects on calcium influx in sensory neurons.

functional_data.summary: L55P TTR induces significant calcium influx in DRG neurons, leading to potential neurotoxicity.

variants.segregation_data: The L55P mutation is associated with familial amyloidotic polyneuropathy.
variants.additional_notes: The L55P variant is noted for its aggressive amyloidosis compared to other variants.
key_quotes: The rare L55P mutation produces a more aggressive amyloidosis than the more common V30M mutation.
L55P induced calcium influx into DRG neurons, similar to that observed using SH-SY5Y cells.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper focused on the TTR gene and its variants.
